query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
1 O voi che siete in piccioletta barca, 2 desiderosi d’ascoltar, seguiti 3 dietro al mio legno che cantando varca,
4 tornate a riveder li vostri liti: 5 non vi mettete in pelago, ché forse, 6 perdendo me, rimarreste smarriti.
query.result:
1 O you who are in a small boat, 2 desirous of listening, followed 3 behind my wood that singing crosses,
4 return to see your shores: 5 do not put yourselves into the open sea, because perhaps, 6 losing me, you would remain lost.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
7 L’acqua ch’io prendo già mai non si corse; 8 Minerva spira, e conducemi Appollo, 9 e nove Muse mi dimostran l’Orse.

Please translate each line literally into English.
10 Voialtri pochi che drizzaste il collo 11 per tempo al pan de li angeli, del quale 12 vivesi qui ma non sen vien satollo,
13 metter potete ben per l’alto sale 14 vostro navigio, servando mio solco 15 dinanzi a l’acqua che ritorna equale.
query.result:
10 You others few who straightened the neck 11 in time to the bread of the angels, from which 12 one lives here but does not become full,
13 you can well put for the high sea 14 your ship, keeping my only furrow 15 before the water that returns level.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
16 Que’ glorïosi che passaro al Colco 17 non s’ammiraron come voi farete, 18 quando Iasón vider fatto bifolco.
query.result: 16 Those glorious ones who passed to Colchis 17 were not admired as you will do, 18 when Jason was seen made two-hulled.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
19 La concreata e perpetüa sete 20 del deïforme regno cen portava 21 veloci quasi come ’l ciel vedete.
query.result: 19 The congealed and perpetual thirst 20 of the god-shaped realm brought forth 21 swift, almost as you see the sky.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
22 Beatrice in suso, e io in lei guardava; 23 e forse in tanto in quanto un quadrel posa 24 e vola e da la noce si dischiava,
25 giunto mi vidi ove mirabil cosa 26 mi torse il viso a sé; e però quella 27 cui non potea mia cura essere ascosa,
28 volta ver’ me, sì lieta come bella, 29 «Drizza la mente in Dio grata», mi disse, 30 «che n’ha congiunti con la prima stella».
query.result:
22 Beatrice above, and I in her was looking; 23 and perhaps in as much as a square rests 24 and flies and from the nut frees itself,
25 joined I saw where a marvelous thing 26 turned my face to itself; and therefore that one 27 to whom my care could not be hidden,
28 turned towards me, so joyful as beautiful, 29 “Lift your mind to God grateful,” she said to me, 30 “who has joined you with the first star.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
31 Parev’ a me che nube ne coprisse 32 lucida, spessa, solida e pulita, 33 quasi adamante che lo sol ferisse.
query.result: 31 It seemed to me that a cloud covered me 32 shining, dense, solid and clean, 33 almost like adamant that the sun struck.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
34 Per entro sé l’etterna margarita 35 ne ricevette, com’ acqua recepe 36 raggio di luce permanendo unita.
query.result: 34 Within herself the eternal marguerite 35 received it, as water receives 36 ray of light remaining united.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
37 S’io era corpo, e qui non si concepe 38 com’ una dimensione altra patio, 39 ch’esser convien se corpo in corpo repe,
40 accender ne dovria più il disio 41 di veder quella essenza in che si vede 42 come nostra natura e Dio s’unio.
query.result:
37 If I was a body, and here it is not conceived 38 how another dimension can be sustained, 39 that must be if a body is repeated in a body,
40 it would have to ignite more the desire 41 to see that essence in which it is seen 42 how our nature and God are united.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
43 Lì si vedrà ciò che tenem per fede, 44 non dimostrato, ma fia per sé noto 45 a guisa del ver primo che l’uom crede.
query.result: 43 There will be seen what we hold by faith, 44 not demonstrated, but will be known by itself 45 in the manner of the first truth that man believes.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
46 Io rispuosi: «Madonna, sì devoto 47 com’ esser posso più, ringrazio lui 48 lo qual dal mortal mondo m’ha remoto.
query.result: 46 I responded: “Lady, as devoted 47 as I can be more, I thank him 48 who from the mortal world has removed me.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
49 Ma ditemi: che son li segni bui 50 di questo corpo, che là giuso in terra 51 fan di Cain favoleggiare altrui?».
query.result: 49 But tell me: what are the dark signs 50 of this body, which down there on earth 51 make others fable about Cain?

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
52 Ella sorrise alquanto, e poi «S’elli erra 53 l’oppinïon», mi disse, «d’i mortali 54 dove chiave di senso non diserra,
55 certo non ti dovrien punger li strali 56 d’ammirazione omai, poi dietro ai sensi 57 vedi che la ragione ha corte l’ali.
query.result:
52 She smiled somewhat, and then “If he errs 53 the opinion,” she said to me, “of mortals 54 where the key of sense does not unlock,
55 certainly you should no longer be pierced by the arrows 56 of admiration, since behind the senses 57 you see that reason has shortened its wings.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
58 Ma dimmi quel che tu da te ne pensi». 59 E io: «Ciò che n’appar qua sù diverso 60 credo che fanno i corpi rari e densi».
query.result: 58 But tell me what you think of it from yourself.” 59 And I: “What appears here above different 60 I believe that rare and dense bodies make.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
61 Ed ella: «Certo assai vedrai sommerso 62 nel falso il creder tuo, se bene ascolti 63 l’argomentar ch’io li farò avverso.
query.result: 61 And she: “Certainly you will see submerged 62 in falsehood your belief, if you listen well 63 to the argumentation that I will make against it.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
64 La spera ottava vi dimostra molti 65 lumi, li quali e nel quale e nel quanto 66 notar si posson di diversi volti.
query.result: 64 The eighth sphere shows you many 65 lights, which both in which and in how much 66 can be noted of different appearances.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
67 Se raro e denso ciò facesser tanto, 68 una sola virtù sarebbe in tutti, 69 più e men distributa e altrettanto.
query.result: 67 If rare and dense made it so much, 68 one single virtue would be in all, 69 more and less distributed and equally.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
70 Virtù diverse esser convegnon frutti 71 di princìpi formali, e quei, for ch’uno, 72 seguiterieno a tua ragion distrutti.
query.result: 70 Diverse virtues must be fruits 71 of formal principles, and those, because one, 72 would follow destroyed to your reason.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
73 Ancor, se raro fosse di quel bruno 74 cagion che tu dimandi, o d’oltre in parte 75 fora di sua materia sì digiuno
76 esto pianeto, o, sì come comparte 77 lo grasso e ’l magro un corpo, così questo 78 nel suo volume cangerebbe carte.
query.result:
73 Still, if rare were of that dark one 74 the cause that you ask, or from beyond a part 75 outside of its matter so hungry
76 would be this planet, or, as shares 77 the fat and the lean one body, thus this 78 within its volume would change pages.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
79 Se ’l primo fosse, fora manifesto 80 ne l’eclissi del sol, per trasparere 81 lo lume come in altro raro ingesto.
query.result: 79 If the first were, it would be manifest 80 in the eclipse of the sun, to shine through 81 the light as in another rare instance.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
82 Questo non è: però è da vedere 83 de l’altro; e s’elli avvien ch’io l’altro cassi, 84 falsificato fia lo tuo parere.
query.result: 82 This is not: therefore it is to be seen 83 of the other; and if it happens that I break the other, 84 falsified will be your opinion.

85 If it is that this rare one does not pass through, 86 it must be a limit from which 87 its contrary does not allow to pass more;
88 and from there the other ray is reflected 89 just as color returns through glass 90 which hides lead behind itself.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
91 Or dirai tu ch’el si dimostra tetro 92 ivi lo raggio più che in altre parti, 93 per esser lì refratto più a retro.
query.result: 91 Or will you say that it shows dark there 92 there the ray more than in other parts, 93 to be there refracted more backwards.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
94 Da questa instanza può deliberarti 95 esperïenza, se già mai la provi, 96 ch’esser suol fonte ai rivi di vostr’ arti.
query.result: 94 From this instance can deliberate to you 95 experience, if ever you prove it, 96 that it is wont to be a source to the rivers of your arts.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
97 Tre specchi prenderai; e i due rimovi 98 da te d’un modo, e l’altro, più rimosso, 99 tr’ambo li primi li occhi tuoi ritrovi.
query.result: 97 Three mirrors you will take; and the two remove 98 from you in one way, and the other, more removed, 99 through both the first find your eyes.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
100 Rivolto ad essi, fa che dopo il dosso 101 ti stea un lume che i tre specchi accenda 102 e torni a te da tutti ripercosso.
query.result: 100 Turned towards them, make that after the hump 101 there stands a light that the three mirrors ignite 102 and returns to you from all reflected back.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
103 Ben che nel quanto tanto non si stenda 104 la vista più lontana, lì vedrai 105 come convien ch’igualmente risplenda.
query.result: 103 Although in the quantity so much does not extend 104 the sight further, there you will see 105 as it is necessary that equally it shines.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
106 Or, come ai colpi de li caldi rai 107 de la neve riman nudo il suggetto 108 e dal colore e dal freddo primai,
109 così rimaso te ne l’intelletto 110 voglio informar di luce sì vivace, 111 che ti tremolerà nel suo aspetto.
query.result:
106 Or, as to the blows of the warm rays 107 of the snow remains bare the subject 108 and from the color and from the cold first,
109 thus remaining in your intellect 110 I want to inform with light so vivid, 111 that it will tremble in its appearance.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
112 Dentro dal ciel de la divina pace 113 si gira un corpo ne la cui virtute 114 l’esser di tutto suo contento giace.
query.result: 112 Within from the sky of the divine peace 113 turns a body in whose virtue 114 the being of all its contentment lies.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
115 Lo ciel seguente, c’ha tante vedute, 116 quell’ esser parte per diverse essenze, 117 da lui distratte e da lui contenute.
query.result: 115 The following heaven, which has so many sights, 116 that being parts through diverse essences, 117 from him distracted and by him contained.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
118 Li altri giron per varie differenze 119 le distinzion che dentro da sé hanno 120 dispongono a lor fini e lor semenze.
query.result: 118 The others revolve through various differences 119 the distinctions that within from themselves have 120 dispose them to their ends and their seeds.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
121 Questi organi del mondo così vanno, 122 come tu vedi omai, di grado in grado, 123 che di sù prendono e di sotto fanno.
query.result: 121 These organs of the world thus go, 122 as you see now, from degree to degree, 123 that from above take and from below make.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
124 Riguarda bene omai sì com’ io vado 125 per questo loco al vero che disiri, 126 sì che poi sappi sol tener lo guado.
query.result: 124 Look well now as I go 125 through this place to the truth that you desire, 126 so that afterwards you know only to hold the passage.

127 The motion and the virtue of the holy circles, 128 as from the smith the art of the hammer, 129 from blessed movers must come to breathe;
130 and the heaven to which so many lights make beautiful, 131 from the deep mind that turns it 132 takes the image and makes of it a seal.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
133 E come l’alma dentro a vostra polve 134 per differenti membra e conformate 135 a diverse potenze si risolve,
136 così l’intelligenza sua bontate 137 multiplicata per le stelle spiega, 138 girando sé sovra sua unitate.
query.result:
133 And as the soul within your dust 134 through different limbs and shaped 135 to diverse powers resolves itself,
136 thus its intelligence its goodness 137 multiplied through the stars expands, 138 revolving itself over its unity.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
139 Virtù diversa fa diversa lega 140 col prezïoso corpo ch’ella avviva, 141 nel qual, sì come vita in voi, si lega.
query.result: 139 Different virtue makes different bond 140 with the precious body that it vivifies, 141 in which, as life in you, is bound.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
142 Per la natura lieta onde deriva, 143 la virtù mista per lo corpo luce 144 come letizia per pupilla viva.
query.result: 142 Through the joyful nature from which it derives, 143 the mixed virtue through the body shines 144 as joy through living pupil.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
145 Da essa vien ciò che da luce a luce 146 par differente, non da denso e raro; 147 essa è formal principio che produce,
148 conforme a sua bontà, lo turbo e ’l chiaro».
query.result:
145 From it comes that which from light to light 146 appears different, not from dense and rare; 147 it is the formal principle that produces,
148 conforming to its goodness, the murky and the clear.
